get.description:
Returns a paged list of activity logs using cursor-based paging and property filters.

**Common Use Cases:**
- Audit user actions across your organization
- Monitor scenario changes and deletion
- Track team membership changes

**Pagination:** Use the `next` value from `_page` as the `start` parameter for subsequent requests to iterate through all results.

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: Fusion organization ID

parameters.name: property
parameters.description:
Property filters for refining results. Multiple filters can be specified and are AND-ed together.

**Example Usage:**
- Single filter: `property=entity==scenario`
- Multiple filters: `property=entity==scenario&property=action==created`

**Allowed Fields:**
`timestamp`, `entity`, `entityId`, `action`, `teamId`, `teamName`, `userId`, `userName`, `messageId`, `message`

**Operators:**
- `==` equals
- `!=` not equals
- `>` greater than
- `>=` greater than or equal to
- `<` less than
- `<=` less than or equal to
- `~` case-insensitive regex match

**Field Existence:**
- `field` - field exists
- `!field` - field does not exist

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items to return

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Paging cursor. Must be a timestamp (UTC) corresponding to the "timestamp" field. Used only when orderby is set.

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: Sort order. Only timestamp (UTC) is supported. Prefix with "-" for descending or "+" for ascending

items.message: John Snow updated "Update Project tasks (Data Store Project)" scenario

400.description: Bad request - Invalid parameters or filters

value.title: Paging parameters require orderby to be specified

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X GET 'https://fusion.adobe.io/api/v3/activity-logs/2245?limit=50&orderby=-timestamp&property=entity==scenario' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN' \
  -H 'x-api-key: YOUR_CLIENT_ID' \
  -H 'x-gw-ims-org-id: YOUR_ORG_ID@AdobeOrg' \
  -H 'x-gw-region: YOUR_REGION'

get.description:
Exports activity logs as CSV or XLSX based on the Accept header. Use this endpoint to download activity logs for offline analysis, compliance reporting, or integration with external tools.

**Export Formats:**
- CSV: Set `Accept: text/csv` (default)
- Excel: Set `Accept: application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet`

**Note:** Large exports may take several seconds to generate.

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: Fusion organization ID

parameters.name: accept
parameters.description:
Response media type for the exported file.

**Supported values:**
- `text/csv` - Export as CSV (default)
- `application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet` - Export as Excel (.xlsx)

parameters.name: property
parameters.description:
Property filters for refining results. Multiple filters can be specified and are AND-ed together.

**Example Usage:**
- Single filter: `property=entity==scenario`
- Multiple filters: `property=entity==scenario&property=action==created`

**Allowed Fields:**
`timestamp`, `entity`, `entityId`, `action`, `teamId`, `teamName`, `userId`, `userName`, `messageId`, `message`

**Operators:**
- `==` equals
- `!=` not equals
- `>` greater than
- `>=` greater than or equal to
- `<` less than
- `<=` less than or equal to
- `~` case-insensitive regex match

**Field Existence:**
- `field` - field exists
- `!field` - field does not exist

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: Sort order. Only timestamp (UTC) is supported. Prefix with "-" for descending or "+" for ascending

text/csv.example:
timestamp,userId,userName,teamId,teamName,entity,entityId,action,message
2025-12-09T11:39:34.834Z,2555,John Snow,34,My Team,scenario,38641,updated,"John Snow updated 'Update Project tasks' scenario"
2025-12-09T10:12:01.000Z,2556,Jane Doe,34,My Team,scenario,38642,created,"Jane Doe created 'New Integration' scenario"

x-codeSamples.label: cURL (CSV)
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X GET 'https://fusion.adobe.io/api/v3/activity-logs/2245/export?orderby=-timestamp' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN' \
  -H 'x-api-key: YOUR_CLIENT_ID' \
  -H 'x-gw-ims-org-id: YOUR_ORG_ID@AdobeOrg' \
  -H 'x-gw-region: YOUR_REGION' \
  -H 'Accept: text/csv' \
  -o activity-logs.csv

x-codeSamples.label: cURL (Excel)
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X GET 'https://fusion.adobe.io/api/v3/activity-logs/2245/export?orderby=-timestamp' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN' \
  -H 'x-api-key: YOUR_CLIENT_ID' \
  -H 'x-gw-ims-org-id: YOUR_ORG_ID@AdobeOrg' \
  -H 'x-gw-region: YOUR_REGION' \
  -H 'Accept: application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet' \
  -o activity-logs.xlsx

get.description:
Retrieves operation counts for an organization, optionally filtered by team, scenario, and/or package, with optional grouping by dimension.

**Common Use Cases:**
- Monitor daily or monthly operation consumption across your organization
- Track operation usage per team or scenario
- Identify high-volume scenarios consuming the most operations
- Generate usage reports grouped by module or package

**Grouping:** Use the `groupBy` parameter to break down operation counts by `team`, `scenario`, `package`, or `module`. When set, each time-period entry in the response includes a nested array broken down by the chosen group.

**Filtering:** Use the `property` parameter to filter results by operation count (e.g., only show entries with 100+ operations).

**Date Range:** The `from` and `to` parameters define the time window. The maximum allowed range is 1 year. Results are automatically grouped by `day` or `month` depending on the range.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
Start date in ISO 8601 format (UTC). Defines the beginning of the date range for operation counts.

**Note:** Date range between `from` and `to` cannot exceed 1 year.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description:
End date in ISO 8601 format (UTC). Defines the end of the date range for operation counts.

**Note:** Date range between `from` and `to` cannot exceed 1 year.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: Fusion organization ID. All results are scoped to this organization.

parameters.name: teamId
parameters.description: Filter results to a specific team. When provided, only operations for this team are returned.

parameters.name: scenarioId
parameters.description:
Filter results to a specific scenario.

**Note:** Requires `teamId` to also be specified.

parameters.name: package
parameters.description:
Filter results to a specific package name.

**Note:** Requires `scenarioId` to also be specified.

parameters.name: groupBy
parameters.description:
Group operation counts by a specific dimension. When set, each time-period entry in the response includes a nested array broken down by the chosen group.

**Available Groups:**
- `module` - Group by module name
- `package` - Group by package name
- `scenario` - Group by scenario ID
- `team` - Group by team ID

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description:
Sort results by timestamp. Prefix with `+` for ascending or `-` for descending.

**Values:**
- `+timestamp` - Oldest first (ascending)
- `-timestamp` - Newest first (descending)

**Default:** Oldest first (`+timestamp`).

parameters.name: property
parameters.description:
Filter results by operations count. When `groupBy` is used, filters the nested arrays by their operations value.

**Format:** `operations<operator><value>`

**Operators:**
- `==` equals
- `!=` not equals
- `>` greater than
- `>=` greater than or equal to
- `<` less than
- `<=` less than or equal to

400.description: Bad request - Invalid parameters or date range

errors: teamId must be a number conforming to the specified constraints

value.title: scenarioId requires teamId to be specified

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X GET 'https://fusion.adobe.io/api/v3/operations?organizationId=12345&from=2025-01-01T12:00:00.000Z&to=2025-02-01T12:00:00.000Z&orderBy=-timestamp' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN' \
  -H 'x-api-key: YOUR_CLIENT_ID' \
  -H 'x-gw-ims-org-id: YOUR_ORG_ID@AdobeOrg' \
  -H 'x-gw-region: YOUR_REGION'

x-codeSamples.label: cURL (grouped by team)
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X GET 'https://fusion.adobe.io/api/v3/operations?organizationId=12345&from=2025-01-01T12:00:00.000Z&to=2025-02-01T12:00:00.000Z&groupBy=team&orderBy=-timestamp' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN' \
  -H 'x-api-key: YOUR_CLIENT_ID' \
  -H 'x-gw-ims-org-id: YOUR_ORG_ID@AdobeOrg' \
  -H 'x-gw-region: YOUR_REGION'

get.description:
Retrieves a summary of total operation counts for an organization, broken down by scenario and team. Use this endpoint to get a high-level overview of operation consumption without time-series data.

**Common Use Cases:**
- Identify which scenarios consume the most operations
- Compare operation usage across teams
- Find underperforming or overloaded scenarios

**Sorting:** Use the `orderBy` parameter to sort results by `scenarioId`, `teamId`, or `operations` count in ascending or descending order.

**Filtering:** Use the `property` parameter to filter scenarios by their total operation count (e.g., only show scenarios with 100+ operations).

**Date Range:** The `from` and `to` parameters define the time window for aggregation. The maximum allowed range is 1 year.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
Start date in ISO 8601 format (UTC). Defines the beginning of the date range for the summary.

**Note:** Date range between `from` and `to` cannot exceed 1 year.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description:
End date in ISO 8601 format (UTC). Defines the end of the date range for the summary.

**Note:** Date range between `from` and `to` cannot exceed 1 year.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: Fusion organization ID. All results are scoped to this organization.

parameters.name: teamId
parameters.description: Filter results to a specific team. When provided, only scenarios belonging to this team are included in the summary.

parameters.name: scenarioId
parameters.description: Filter results to a specific scenario. Returns the operation count for this single scenario.

parameters.name: package
parameters.description: Filter results to a specific package name.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description:
Sort summary results by field. Prefix with `+` for ascending or `-` for descending.

**Sortable Fields:**
- `scenarioId` - Sort by scenario ID
- `teamId` - Sort by team ID
- `operations` - Sort by operation count

**Default:** `-operations` (highest operation count first).

parameters.name: property
parameters.description:
Filter scenarios by their total operations count within the specified date range.

**Format:** `operations<operator><value>`

**Operators:**
- `==` equals
- `!=` not equals
- `>` greater than
- `>=` greater than or equal to
- `<` less than
- `<=` less than or equal to

400.description: Bad request - Invalid parameters or date range

errors: teamId must be a number conforming to the specified constraints

value.title: Invalid orderBy field. Supported: scenarioId, teamId, operations

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X GET 'https://fusion.adobe.io/api/v3/operations/summary?organizationId=12345&from=2025-01-01T12:00:00.000Z&to=2025-02-01T12:00:00.000Z&orderBy=-operations' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN' \
  -H 'x-api-key: YOUR_CLIENT_ID' \
  -H 'x-gw-ims-org-id: YOUR_ORG_ID@AdobeOrg' \
  -H 'x-gw-region: YOUR_REGION'

x-codeSamples.label: cURL (filtered by team)
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X GET 'https://fusion.adobe.io/api/v3/operations/summary?organizationId=12345&from=2025-01-01T12:00:00.000Z&to=2025-02-01T12:00:00.000Z&teamId=67890&orderBy=-operations&property=operations>=100' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN' \
  -H 'x-api-key: YOUR_CLIENT_ID' \
  -H 'x-gw-ims-org-id: YOUR_ORG_ID@AdobeOrg' \
  -H 'x-gw-region: YOUR_REGION'

info.title: Workfront Fusion API
info.description:
REST APIs for managing and monitoring your Workfront Fusion resources. Use these APIs to programmatically access activity logs and other Fusion components coming soon.

**Base URL:** https://fusion.adobe.io

**Getting Started:**

 For detailed setup instructions, make sure to visit the [Getting Started guide](https://developer-stage.adobe.com/workfront-fusion-apis/getting-started/). 
1. Set up authentication in Adobe Developer Console, as documented [here](https://developer-stage.adobe.com/workfront-fusion-apis/getting-started/authentication/). 
2. Obtain required headers (Authorization, x-api-key, x-gw-ims-org-id, x-gw-region). More details [here](https://developer-stage.adobe.com/workfront-fusion-apis/getting-started/api_headers/). 
3. Update permissions for the technical account, as documented [here](https://developer-stage.adobe.com/workfront-fusion-apis/getting-started/technical_accounts/). 
4. Make your first API call.

tags.name: Activity Logs
tags.description: Endpoints for getting and exporting log of activities, such as creating a scenario or inviting a user, for your organization. Please note, for accessing activity logs, user must be a Workfront Fusion administrator for the organization.

externalDocs.description: Find out more in product documentation.

tags.name: Operations
tags.description: Endpoints for getting operation count in a particular Fusion organization, grouped by various parameters. An operation is a task performed by a module. For tracking purposes, any successful action performed by a module is an operation.

externalDocs.description: Find out more in product documentation.

Authorization.description:
**Required.** IMS access token for authenticating the user or technical account making the request.

See the [Authentication guide](https://developer-stage.adobe.com/workfront-fusion-apis/getting-started/authentication/) for detailed instructions on obtaining access tokens.

[API Headers Documentation](https://developer-stage.adobe.com/workfront-fusion-apis/getting-started/api_headers/)

IMS Org ID.name: x-gw-ims-org-id
IMS Org ID.description:
**Required.** Your IMS Organization ID. This validates that the Fusion product is provisioned for your organization and that the user or technical account has appropriate access.

**Example:** `1234567890ABCDEF@AdobeOrg`

[API Headers Documentation](https://developer-stage.adobe.com/workfront-fusion-apis/getting-started/api_headers/)

API Key.name: x-api-key
API Key.description:
**Required.** Your application's Client ID from Adobe Developer Console. This identifies your application and is the same value used for IMS authentication.

[API Headers Documentation](https://developer-stage.adobe.com/workfront-fusion-apis/getting-started/api_headers/)

Region.name: x-gw-region
Region.description:
**Required.** Routes requests to the correct Fusion regional instance.

**Example:** `or2`

[API Headers Documentation](https://developer-stage.adobe.com/workfront-fusion-apis/getting-started/api_headers/)

errors.description: Validation errors (only present for validation failures)
example: email must be a valid email address
password must be at least 8 characters

type.description: Error type based on HTTP status or validation error

report.description: Error report with request tracking and additional details

ActivityLogDto.description: Represents a single activity event in your Fusion organization. Each log entry captures who performed what action on which entity at a specific time.

timestamp.description: UTC timestamp when the activity occurred. Use this field for time-based filtering and sorting.

userId.description: User ID who triggered the activity

messageId.description: Unique identifier for this activity log entry (UUID format). Use for deduplication and tracking.

teamId.description: Team ID associated with the activity

entityId.description: Unique identifier of the specific entity that was affected (e.g., scenario ID, connection ID)

message.example: John Snow updated "Update Project tasks (Data Store Project)" scenario

Page.description: Pagination metadata for cursor-based paging. Use the `next` value as the `start` parameter in your next request to retrieve the following page.

start.description: First sort value on this page

next.description: Cursor value to use as the `start` parameter for the next page. If null, you've reached the last page.

count.description: Number of items in this page

ActivityLogsResponseDto.description: Response containing a page of activity logs with navigation links and metadata for cursor-based pagination.

items.description: Activity log entries for the current page

operations.description: Number of operations for this scenario
Number of operations for this team
Number of operations for this package
Number of operations for this module

scenarios.description: Operations grouped by scenario (present when grouped by scenario)

teams.description: Operations grouped by team (present when grouped by team)

packages.description: Operations grouped by package (present when grouped by package)

modules.description: Operations grouped by module (present when grouped by module)

operations.description: Total operations count (present when no grouping is applied)

items.description: Array of operation count data points, sorted by timestamp (see orderBy when provided)

timeUnit.description: Time unit used for grouping the results

orderBy.description: Present when orderBy was provided in the request; reflects how items are sorted by timestamp

operations.description: Number of operations for this scenario and team combination

items.description: Array of operation summaries by scenario and team

totalOperations.description: Total sum of all operations across all scenarios and teams

orderBy.description: Present when orderBy was provided in the request; reflects how items are sorted
